title: Create sarkariform.com website for publishing government recruitment updates

requirements.text: Implement a content model for government recruitment publishing with post types: Recruitment Form, Admit Card, Result, Answer Key. Each post must support: title, organization/department, exam/post name, important dates (as labeled key/value pairs), eligibility (free text), application fee (free text), age limit (free text), vacancy/selection details (free text), official links (one or more URLs with labels), status (Draft/Published), tags, and created/updated timestamps.

quotes: I want to create my own website for publishing government recruitment forms, Admit Card, Result, Answer key etc.

acceptanceCriteria: Backend stores posts with a type field supporting the 4 required post types.
Frontend forms allow creating/editing all required fields.
Draft posts are not visible on public pages; Published posts are visible.
Posts display created/updated timestamps in the UI.

requirements.text: Add an admin publishing workflow secured by Internet Identity: only authenticated admins can create, edit, publish/unpublish, or delete posts; unauthenticated users can only browse/search published content.

quotes: create my own website for publishing government recruitment forms

acceptanceCriteria: A user can sign in with Internet Identity.
The backend enforces admin-only mutations (create/update/delete/publish).
Non-admin authenticated users cannot mutate content.
Public users can read published content without signing in.

requirements.text: Create public-facing pages for sarkariform.com: Home, category landing pages for each post type (Recruitment Form, Admit Card, Result, Answer Key), post detail page, and a site-wide search page.

quotes: publishing government recruitment forms, Admit Card, Result, Answer key

acceptanceCriteria: Home page shows latest published items across all types.
Each category page lists only its corresponding post type with pagination or infinite load.
Post detail page renders all structured fields (dates, links, sections) clearly.
Search page returns published posts matching query across title/exam/organization/tags.

requirements.text: Add sorting and filtering for public listings: sort by newest/updated; filter by organization/department and by tags; allow narrowing by year (based on created date).
acceptanceCriteria: Users can sort lists by Newest and Recently Updated.
Users can filter by organization/department (text or selectable list based on available data).
Users can filter by tag and by year.
Filters are reflected in the URL (query params) so pages are shareable.

requirements.text: Add SEO-friendly metadata and sharing basics for public pages: page titles, meta descriptions, and a consistent canonical-like URL structure for categories and posts.

quotes: I want to name it sarkariform.com

acceptanceCriteria: Each public page sets a meaningful document title including “sarkariform.com” or “Sarkari Form”.
Post detail pages include a description derived from the post content (e.g., first paragraph/summary).
Category pages include type-specific titles/descriptions (e.g., “Latest Admit Cards”).

requirements.text: Create a cohesive visual theme for the site (colors, typography, spacing, and components) suitable for an information-dense government-jobs portal, and apply it consistently across all pages. Avoid blue/purple as primary colors.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme is consistent across navigation, listings, filters, and detail pages.
Layout remains readable for long-form content on mobile and desktop.
Primary color palette does not use blue/purple as the dominant brand color.

requirements.text: Generate and render required static brand assets for sarkariform.com (logo + favicon), and integrate them into the header and browser tab.

quotes: I want to name it sarkariform.com

acceptanceCriteria: Logo is stored under frontend/public/assets/generated and used in the site header.
Favicon is stored under frontend/public/assets/generated and configured for the app.
Brand text shown in UI is “SarkariForm” (or “sarkariform.com”) consistently.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in backend/main.mo).
Do not edit any frontend files under the immutablePaths list; compose functionality around them instead.
Use English for all user-facing UI text.
nonGoals: No third-party auth providers other than Internet Identity.
No external database or third-party CMS integration.
No real-time notifications, email/SMS alerts, or push notifications.

required: Wordmark logo reading “SarkariForm” in a bold, legible style (sarkariform-logo.dim_1200x300.png)
Simple favicon icon with an “SF” monogram inside a rounded shape (sarkariform-favicon.dim_256x256.png)

goalsToAdd: Build a website (sarkariform.com) to publish government recruitment forms, admit cards, results, and answer keys.
